conbody.p: And now we can finally discuss Yesod itself. If we're looking through the typical Model-View-Controller (MVC) paradigm, Persistent is the model and Sheakespeare is the view. This would leave Yesod as the controller.

The most basic feature of Yesod is routing. This features a declarative syntax and type-safe dispatch. Layered on top of this, Yesod provides many other features: streaming content generation, widgets, i18n, static files, forms and authentication. But the core feature added by Yesod is really routing.

At the highest level, Yesod provides a scaffolding tool that automatically generates a "best-practices" site shell that integrates all of these features (plus all the features of Shakespeare and Persistent) together. This lets you go quickly from a nice idea to a production-quality site.

And besides all of the developer-friendly features, Yesod is providing a huge number of optimizations for you under the surface. Cache-busting files, minification, and asynchronous Javascript loading are all added on top of the already extensive list of performance enhancement previously described in this chapter.
